name: setStyle()
content: Apps in App Lab are composed of HTML elements, such as buttons. While these elements can be styled to some extent using the Design Tab, more advanced styling (or any styling of programmatically created elements) can be achieved by using CSS. This advanced function allows assigning CSS styles to HTML design elements in an app.

examples.name: Fancy Button
examples.description: Apply several different styles to a single element

examples.name: Big and Bold
examples.description: Apply style to make a programmatically created text label bold and large.

palette_params.name: id
palette_params.description: The ID of a design element to be styled.

palette_params.name: css
palette_params.description: A string of CSS, using inline syntax.

short_description: Apps in App Lab are composed of HTML elements, such as buttons. While these elements can be styled to some extent using the Design Tab, more advanced styling (or any styling of programmatically created elements) can be achieved by using CSS. This advanced function allows assigning CSS styles to HTML design elements in an app.
tips: * Calling setStyle multiple times on the same element won't overwrite its style, but will append new styles on top of existing ones.
